abstract.p: A Wilson prime is a prime p such that (p − 1)! = −1 (mod p²). We report on a search for Wilson primes up to 2 × 10¹³, and describe several new algorithms that were used in the search. In particular, we give the first known algorithm that computes (p − 1)! (mod p²) in average polynomial time per prime.
